<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [cb6f32763e](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18188/commits/cb6f32763ef9b87b88ba61286e835735db6e1b81)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ t2Space_antitone`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

@scholzhannah can you explain why you want this lemma anyway? Are you using it in another PR?

It's not a big deal to add it I suppose, but it seems like it wouldn't come in handy very often (if ever).

> @scholzhannah can you explain why you want this lemma anyway? Are you using it in another PR?
> 
> It's not a big deal to add it I suppose, but it seems like it wouldn't come in handy very often (if ever).

I use it for the product of CW-complexes (which I hope will be a PR at some point). I need to define a finer topology on the product and have it still be a Hausdorff space. But I think I am only using it that one time and I don't know how useful that lemma is in general.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11506141371/job/32029400358)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11506141371/job/32029400984)

That's fine then, thanks!

bors merge

Thank you for the PR, this is definitely a missing lemma. Your proof is locally optimal, good job!
Rewriting by a different lemma, a slightly shorter proof is possible. I am personally not sure which one is nicer, and will let the maintainers decide.

Thank you for the PR, this is definitely a missing lemma. Your proof is locally optimal, good job!
Rewriting by a different lemma, a slightly shorter proof is possible. I am personally not sure which one is nicer, and will let the maintainers decide.

That's fine then, thanks!

bors merge

This is not a complaint, but meant to explain mathlib style.
I understand where your naming is coming from. This might even be a better convention than mathlib style - but my impression is that one would commonly call these `hU` or `hV` (instead of `openu` and `openv`), relying on hovering/the infoview to read the code). Similarly, my intuition is to rename `le` -> `hst` and `t2` -> `hX`.
Some of this may be my personal taste. I would certainly recommend renaming to `hU` and `hV`, and not insist on the others.
Thank you, that's good to know!

There's a slight duplication in the last two lines, which is why I wondered if this can be golfed. (The analogous proof for `T1Space` is one, highly golfed, line.) Locally, it cannot (well done!). Rewriting by a different lemma yields a shorter proof.

A first version could be
```
  intro s t hst hX
  rw [t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds] at hX
  rw [@t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds X s]
  exact fun x y hxy ↦ (hX hxy).mono (nhds_mono hst) (nhds_mono hst)
```
and then you can play code golf this shorten this a bit, to e.g.:
```
  intro s t hst hX
  exact (@t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds X s).mpr
    (fun x y hxy ↦ ((t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds.mp hX) hxy).mono (nhds_mono hst) (nhds_mono hst))
```
or (using full term mode)
```
theorem t2Space_antitone2 {X : Type*} : Antitone (@T2Space X) := fun s _ hst hX ↦
  (@t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds X s).mpr
    (fun _ _ hxy ↦ ((t2Space_iff_disjoint_nhds.mp hX) hxy).mono (nhds_mono hst) (nhds_mono hst))
```
I'll let maintainers decide which version they prefer.

If you move this further down in the file, you can make use of a nice lemma:
```lean
theorem t2Space_antitone {X : Type*} : Antitone (@T2Space X) :=
  fun inst₁ inst₂ h_top h_t2 ↦ @T2Space.of_injective_continuous _ _ inst₁ inst₂
    h_t2 _ Function.injective_id <| continuous_id_of_le h_top
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `T2Space` is `Antitone`
